page.title: 10Brownies And Cubs
page.content: Many children aged 7-15 are members of the Guide and Scout movement.The first 4 years are known as Brownies or Cubs. There are 24 girls in the 135th Brownie pack.They meet on Monday evenings at 6.15pm at the United Reform Church hall in Whitchurch.The 107th Cub pack meets on Wednesday evenings between 6.30-8.30pm at the Scout hut in Maggs Lane.The Brownies wear a brown uniform and the Cubs wear a green uniform.At the meetings the children play games and prepare different items in order to obtain badges,such as Conservation,Toymaker, Swimming and Safety in the Home.During May the Brownies and Cubs enjoyed camping in Cheddar and Stanton Drew. Brownies and Cubs are so popular that there is a waiting list to join the packs in Whitchurch.
